arm_group.description: Waterjet induced dissection of the liver during resection.Waterjet dissection device mechanically separates hepatic tissue from bile ducts and vessels, the latter two to be separately ligated.
CUSA transection of the liver. Ultrasound based destruction of the liver parenchyma to allow separate ligation of the bile duct and intrahepatic vessels.

brief_summary.textblock:
Before liver transection patients are allocated to either waterjet or CUSA to divide the
      liver parenchyma.

clinical_study.brief_title: Waterjet Versus Ultrasound Dissection During Hepatic Transection

detailed_description.textblock:
Transection time, bloodloss, total operation time and postoperative complication rates are
      registered.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Hepatic tumour suitable for resection

          -  patients 18 year or older Segmental resection Local resection Left sided
             hemihepatectomy

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Right sided hemihepatectoyReresection In Situ Split Liver Extended left- and
             rightsided hemihepatectomy Lobus caudatus resection Central resections Hilus
             tumour/Klatskin/Cholangiocarcinoma Surgery on biliary tree Extended resection on
             other organs

        Resection on gallbladder Resection on other organs during the same operation.

intervention.description: Waterjet induced dissection of the liver during resection.Waterjet dissection device mechanically separates hepatic tissue from bile ducts and vessels, the latter two to be separately ligated.
Ultrasound based destruction of the liver

facility.name: Karolinska University Hospital, Centra of Gastroenterology

clinical_study.official_title: Waterjet Versus Ultrasound Dissection During Hepatic Transection

primary_outcome.description: Peroperative bloodloss in ml  during liver transection by use of either waterjet or CUSA.
primary_outcome.time_frame: During liver transection (on an average<90 min)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During liver transection (on an average< 90 minutes)
Time spent in theater in minutes (on an average <240 minutes)
Days spent in hospital after surgery (on an average < 10 days)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Treatment
